security: The journal entries primarily concern unclassified interactions with congressional offices and committees regarding information requests and logistical arrangements. No specific content appears to pose a risk to ongoing operations, active agents, or sensitive international relations.
summary: This journal entry from the CIA's Office of Legislative Counsel details interactions with congressional offices regarding information requests, including one related to the Kennedy assassination, and logistical arrangements for intelligence-related events.
summary_one_paragraph: This journal entry, dated March 30, 1977, from the CIA's Office of Legislative Counsel (OLC), records several liaison activities. It notes a call from Representative Clarence D. Long's office regarding a constituent's FOIA request for Kennedy assassination material, with a follow-up pending receipt of a newspaper article. It also documents confirming Anne Karalekas' speaking engagements with the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence staff and a Warrenton Training Center conference. Additionally, it mentions a request from Senator Jacob K. Javits' office for a study on climatological research related to intelligence, which was fulfilled.
title: Journal - Office of Legislative Counsel
